meanings.definition: A first or preliminary version of a device or product from which other forms are developed.
meanings.sent1: The company created several prototypes before finalizing the design of the new phone.
meanings.sent2: The prototypes of the new car were tested extensively for safety and performance.
meanings.sent3: The prototypes for the robot vacuum kept bumping into walls during testing.
meanings.sent4: Her sketches served as prototypes for the stunning mural that now adorns the city wall.
meanings.sent5: The prototypes of the new video game console were sleek and futuristic.

meanings.definition: An original model on which something is patterned.
meanings.sent1: The ancient artifact was considered a prototype for future sculptures in the region.
meanings.sent2: The architect used the ancient temple as a prototype for the modern building's design.
meanings.sent3: The prototype of the spaceship looked like it came straight out of a sci-fi movie.
meanings.sent4: Her grandmother's recipe was the prototype for the delicious cookies she baked.
meanings.sent5: The prototype of the new dress was inspired by vintage fashion trends.

meanings.definition: A typical example or representative of a category.
meanings.sent1: The red apple was a perfect prototype of the fruits in the orchard.
meanings.sent2: The professor used the student's essay as a prototype of excellent writing.
meanings.sent3: The prototype of a lazy Sunday involves staying in bed all day.
meanings.sent4: His old truck was a prototype of classic American vehicles from the 1950s.
meanings.sent5: The prototype of a loyal friend always stands by you in tough times.
